Question: How do I parse numbers in a string?: :Closed. This question does not meet Stack Overflow guidelines. It is not currently accepting answers.                                                             This question does not appear to be about programming within the scope defined in the help center.Closed 9 years ago.                        Improve this question                    I have a string 'line' in java containing numbers , for example , "34 55  64 "I want to store these 3 numbers in  int x , y ,zwhen I do ,x = Integer.parseInt(line[0]) y = Integer.parseInt(line[1])I get an error saying a "array required but string found " . I do not understand why it needs an array x,y,z are declared integers and line is declared as a string
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer:
response:
StringTokenizer.nextToken(String s, String separator)

Question: How do I parse numbers in a string?: :Closed. This question does not meet Stack Overflow guidelines. It is not currently accepting answers.                                                             This question does not appear to be about programming within the scope defined in the help center.Closed 9 years ago.                        Improve this question                    I have a string 'line' in java containing numbers , for example , "34 55  64 "I want to store these 3 numbers in  int x , y ,zwhen I do ,x = Integer.parseInt(line[0]) y = Integer.parseInt(line[1])I get an error saying a "array required but string found " . I do not understand why it needs an array x,y,z are declared integers and line is declared as a string

Answer: You can use StringTokenizer to split the string into tokens.

\begin{code}
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line, " ");
int x = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
int y = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
int z = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
\end{code}

Comment: I have a string 'line' in java containing numbers , for example , "34 55  64 "I want to store these 3 numbers in  int x , y ,zwhen I do ,x = Integer.parseInt(line[0]) y = Integer.parseInt(line[1])I get an error saying a "array required but string found " . I do not understand why it needs an array x,y,z are declared integers and line is declared as a string

Comment: @user1234567890: You need to use StringTokenizer to split the string into tokens.
